  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S07 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13098]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Thangam+Ravindranathan">Thangam Ravindranathan</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

	<div id="calendar" class="clear-block block block-calwidget ">
	
	<h2>Calendar</h2>	
		<div class="content"><section class="events-list">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S08 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13099]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


		

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

      <!-- end .columns -->
      
            <div id="sidebar-right" class="sidebar third-column column"> 
	
	<div id="calendar" class="clear-block block block-calwidget ">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S09 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13100]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Gretchen+Schultz">Gretchen Schultz</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Phone</span> <span class="value">401-863-2567</span></div>
	<div class="tel"><span class="type">Fax</span> <span class="value">401-863-2834</span></div>
	<div><a class="email" href="mailto:French_Studies@brown.edu">French_Studies@brown.edu</a></div>

  </div>
    </div>

	</div>

              </div>
      <!-- end .columns -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S10 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13101]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Lewis+C+Seifert">Lewis C Seifert</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

		<div class="content"><div class="view view-contact-information view-id-contact_information view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-1">
    
  
  
      <div class="view-content">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S11 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13102]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Ourida+Mostefai">Ourida Mostefai</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

	<div id="block-brown_social_media-0" class="clear-block block block-brown_social_media ">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S12 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13103]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S13 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13104]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


		

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Reading and Research</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2980 S14 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 13105]</span></h3>


  	Work with individual students in connection with special readings, problems of research, or preparation of theses. Section numbers vary by instructor. Please check Banner for the correct section number and CRN to use when registering for this course.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


		

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>I: Independent Study/Research</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Preliminary Examination Preparation</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2970 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 14978]</span></h3>


  	For graduate students who have completed their course work and are preparing for a preliminary examination.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


		

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>E: Grad Enrollment Fee/Dist Prep</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Thesis Preparation</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2990 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 14979]</span></h3>


  	For graduate students who have met the tuition requirement and are paying the registration fee to continue active enrollment while preparing a thesis.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
		


		

	
				
		
		
					<dt>Meeting Type</dt>
			<dd>E: Grad Enrollment Fee/Dist Prep</dd>
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Basic French</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0100 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15624]</span></h3>


  	This is the first half of a two-semester course. Four meetings a week for oral practice. One hour of work outside of class is expected every day (grammar/writing, oral practice, reading). Enrollment limited to 15.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>First Half of Year Course</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">09:00 - 09:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 207</div>
						<div class="times">13:00 - 14:20 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column"> 
	
	<div id="block-menu-primary-links" class="clear-block block block-menu ">

<li class="leaf menu-officehours"><a href="/academics/french-studies/office-hours" title="Office Hours">Office Hours</a></li>

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

      <a href="/academics/french-studies/" title="" style="height:252px;" class="bare-banner-link"></a>    </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Basic French</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0100 S02 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15625]</span></h3>


  	This is the first half of a two-semester course. Four meetings a week for oral practice. One hour of work outside of class is expected every day (grammar/writing, oral practice, reading). Enrollment limited to 15.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>First Half of Year Course</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">10:00 - 10:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">10:30 - 11:50 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Basic French</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0100 S03 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15626]</span></h3>


  	This is the first half of a two-semester course. Four meetings a week for oral practice. One hour of work outside of class is expected every day (grammar/writing, oral practice, reading). Enrollment limited to 15.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>First Half of Year Course</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">09:00 - 10:20 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">11:00 - 11:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

			</ul>

        </header>
        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

      <a href="/academics/french-studies/" title="" style="height:252px;" class="bare-banner-link"></a>    </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Basic French</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0100 S05 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15628]</span></h3>


  	This is the first half of a two-semester course. Four meetings a week for oral practice. One hour of work outside of class is expected every day (grammar/writing, oral practice, reading). Enrollment limited to 15.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>First Half of Year Course</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 207</div>
						<div class="times">10:30 - 11:50 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">13:00 - 13:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

<div id="brown-masthead">
  <div id="brown-brand">
    <div class="marginator">

  <div id="content">

                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Intermediate French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0400 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15634]</span></h3>


  	Continuation of FREN 0300 but may be taken separately. A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class (three meetings per week plus one 50-minute conversation section). Materials include audio activities, film, and a novel. Short compositions with systematic grammar practice.  Prerequisite: FREN 0300, FREN 0200 with permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">09:00 - 09:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Intermediate French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0400 S02 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15635]</span></h3>


  	Continuation of FREN 0300 but may be taken separately. A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class (three meetings per week plus one 50-minute conversation section). Materials include audio activities, film, and a novel. Short compositions with systematic grammar practice.  Prerequisite: FREN 0300, FREN 0200 with permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">10:00 - 10:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0500 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15640]</span></h3>


  	A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class. Thematic units will focus on songs, poems, a short novel, a graphic novel, films and a longer novel. Activities include a creative project using Comic Life, and a systematic grammar review.  Prerequisite: FREN 0400, FREN 0200 with written permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Justin+Izzo">Justin Izzo</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">10:00 - 10:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0500 S02 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15641]</span></h3>


  	A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class. Thematic units will focus on songs, poems, a short novel, a graphic novel, films and a longer novel. Activities include a creative project using Comic Life, and a systematic grammar review.  Prerequisite: FREN 0400, FREN 0200 with written permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Justin+Izzo">Justin Izzo</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">11:00 - 11:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0500 S03 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15642]</span></h3>


  	A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class. Thematic units will focus on songs, poems, a short novel, a graphic novel, films and a longer novel. Activities include a creative project using Comic Life, and a systematic grammar review.  Prerequisite: FREN 0400, FREN 0200 with written permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Justin+Izzo">Justin Izzo</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">12:00 - 12:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0500 S04 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15643]</span></h3>


  	A four-skill language course that stresses oral interaction in class. Thematic units will focus on songs, poems, a short novel, a graphic novel, films and a longer novel. Activities include a creative project using Comic Life, and a systematic grammar review.  Prerequisite: FREN 0400, FREN 0200 with written permission, or placement.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Justin+Izzo">Justin Izzo</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">13:00 - 13:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0600 S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15644]</span></h3>


  	Prerequisite for study in French-speaking countries. Class time is devoted mainly to conversation and discussion practice. Writing instruction and assignments focus on essays, commentaries, and to a lesser degree, on story writing. Apart from reading assignments for discussion (press articles and literary excerpts), students select two novels to read. Prerequisite: FREN 0500 or placement. Enrollment limited to 15. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Stephanie+A+Ravillon">Stephanie A Ravillon</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">09:00 - 09:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0600 S02 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15648]</span></h3>


  	Prerequisite for study in French-speaking countries. Class time is devoted mainly to conversation and discussion practice. Writing instruction and assignments focus on essays, commentaries, and to a lesser degree, on story writing. Apart from reading assignments for discussion (press articles and literary excerpts), students select two novels to read. Prerequisite: FREN 0500 or placement. Enrollment limited to 15. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Stephanie+A+Ravillon">Stephanie A Ravillon</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">11:00 - 11:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

      <!-- end .third-column -->
          </div>
    <!-- end .marginator --> 
  </div>
  <!-- end #content -->
  
  </div>
<!-- End #wrapper -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0600 S03 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15649]</span></h3>


  	Prerequisite for study in French-speaking countries. Class time is devoted mainly to conversation and discussion practice. Writing instruction and assignments focus on essays, commentaries, and to a lesser degree, on story writing. Apart from reading assignments for discussion (press articles and literary excerpts), students select two novels to read. Prerequisite: FREN 0500 or placement. Enrollment limited to 15. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Stephanie+A+Ravillon">Stephanie A Ravillon</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">13:00 - 13:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <ul>

            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147cc4-5539568d-0155-3b22d593-00000eabevents%40brown.edu/">Date by which advisors must approve sophomore submitted concentrations in ASK to avoid having a "No Concentration" hold placed against the student's Banner registration (5:00 pm deadline)</a>
          </li>
            </div><!-- end .date -->
        </ul>
            <div class="date">
        <h5><span class="month day-of-the-week">
          Nov        </span>
        <span class="day">
          07        </span></h5>
        <ul>
              <li class="event  odd">
            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147cc4-5539568d-0155-3b241d24-000013fcevents%40brown.edu/">Registration for Semester II (Note: No student will be permitted to register for his or her fifth semester unless an approved declaration of concentration has been filed.)</a>
          </li>
          </div><!-- end .date -->
        </ul><!-- close out the last date -->
<div class="more-events">
  <span><a href="http://events.brown.edu/" class="more-link">View all calendars</a></span>
</div><!-- end .more-events -->


</section> <!-- end .events-list -->
</div>
			
				
	</div>

      <!-- end .third-column -->
          </div>
    <!-- end .marginator -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Writing and Speaking French II</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0600 S04 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15653]</span></h3>


  	Prerequisite for study in French-speaking countries. Class time is devoted mainly to conversation and discussion practice. Writing instruction and assignments focus on essays, commentaries, and to a lesser degree, on story writing. Apart from reading assignments for discussion (press articles and literary excerpts), students select two novels to read. Prerequisite: FREN 0500 or placement. Enrollment limited to 15. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Stephanie+A+Ravillon">Stephanie A Ravillon</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">14:00 - 14:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>04</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147cc4-5539568d-0155-3b2132b0-000007c2events%40brown.edu/">Mid-semester deadline. Last day to change from credit to audit in a course (5:00 p.m. deadline).</a>

          23        </span></h5>
        <ul>
              <li class="event  even">
            <a href="http://events.brown.edu/events/cal/CAL-00147cc4-5539568d-0155-3b2276fb-00000c48events%40brown.edu/">Advising period for spring pre-registration. Students in their first through third semesters will need to procure their advising PIN from their advisor in order to register.</a>
          </li>
            </div><!-- end .date -->
        </ul>
            <div class="date">

          Oct        </span>

          31        </span></h5>

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Histoire de la langue française:  usages, politiques et enjeux du français</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1020A S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15693]</span></h3>


  	A study of the evolution of the French language from the Middle Ages to the present. We will trace the main periods of this linguistic, social, historical and political development. Among topics to be explored: France’s encounter with English from the Norman conquest to the current so-called English “invasion,” the French Revolution’s destruction of dialects (patois), and the status of French in France’s former colonial empire. Through a variety of French and francophone texts we will investigate the  transformations brought about by Feminists and by youth from the banlieues and examine the status of French outside of France.  In French. Prerequisite: a course at the 600- or 700-level or equivalent proficiency. Contact the instructor to verify your proficiency if you have not taken French at Brown. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>16</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Ourida+Mostefai">Ourida Mostefai</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">10:30 - 11:50 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>13</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

      <!-- end .columns -->
      
            <div id="sidebar-right" class="sidebar third-column column">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Intermediate French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0300 S02 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15725]</span></h3>


  	A semi-intensive elementary review with emphasis on all four skills (listening, speaking, reading and writing). Class activities include drills, small group activities, and skits. Class materials include videos, a French film, short stories, and various other authentic documents.  Prerequisite: FREN 0200 or placement (Previous experience with French is required to take this class). Four meetings per week, plus a 50-minute conversation section with TAs.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 207</div>
						<div class="times">09:00 - 10:20 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> G18</div>
						<div class="times">11:00 - 11:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

		</div>


</div>
			
				
	</div>


	
	<div id="block-views-contact_information-block_1" class="clear-block block block-views ">
	
		
		<div class="content"><div class="view view-contact-information view-id-contact_information view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-1">
    
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Intermediate French I</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0300 S03 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15726]</span></h3>


  	A semi-intensive elementary review with emphasis on all four skills (listening, speaking, reading and writing). Class activities include drills, small group activities, and skits. Class materials include videos, a French film, short stories, and various other authentic documents.  Prerequisite: FREN 0200 or placement (Previous experience with French is required to take this class). Four meetings per week, plus a 50-minute conversation section with TAs.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Annie+J+Wiart">Annie J Wiart</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">12:00 - 12:50 Mon, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> G18</div>
						<div class="times">13:00 - 14:20 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Paris, ville des Lumi?res</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1310E S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15733]</span></h3>


  	Representations of the city; the crowd; the rise of the individual; the narrator as spectator and promeneur; narratives of social mobility; speed and circulation; sex and the city; Paris as a cultural place. Various authors to be studied:  Marivaux, Fougeret de Monbron, Rousseau, Diderot, Mercier, Restif de la Bretonne. Taught in French. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
		
		


		

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">16:00 - 18:30 Tue - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  </section>
      
  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Au-delà de l’Europe: La France et le monde au XVIIe siècle</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2130H S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15800]</span></h3>


  	In the 17th century, contact with the Middle East, India, the Far East, North and South America, and the Caribbean profoundly changed the ways the French understood themselves and their place in the world. We will study 17th-century depictions of the non-Western world in travel narratives, early ethnographic writing, drama, and fiction, including representations of religious difference, race, slavery, gender, and Orientalism. Readings: Bernier, Champlain, Choisy, Le Code noir, Galland, Marie de l’Incarnation, Les Mille et une nuits, Molière, Montaigne, Racine, the Relations des Jésuites de la Nouvelle-France, Scudéry, Tavernier. Theoretical readings by Anderson, Chakrabarty, Glissant, Said, i.a.  In French.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>16</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Lewis+C+Seifert">Lewis C Seifert</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>11</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
        
                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

      <a href="/academics/french-studies/" title="" style="height:252px;" class="bare-banner-link"></a>    </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Politique et fiction en Afrique</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2600K S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15801]</span></h3>


  	This seminar investigates the political aesthetics of fiction in Francophone Africa with a special focus on our post-millennial period. We will examine new and established writers, filmmakers, and theorists as they rework conventions of postcolonial satirical and protest fiction and address contemporary problems of globalization, corruption, and social violence. How does current Francophone African fiction speak to contemporary political theory, and in what ways does this fiction address and constitute a politics of genre? And how does African fiction use politics to mediate its complicated relationship to theories of world literature?  Taught in French.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>30</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Justin+Izzo">Justin Izzo</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Mon - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>15</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">New Waves from Paris to Hollywood</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1150G S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 15814]</span></h3>


  	“New wave” was coined by a journalist to refer to an “outburst” of filmmaking in France beginning in 1959. Never a movement, and short-lived in terms of whatever aesthetic uniformity it may have had, its effects spread across various European cinemas and became the emblem for a series of American filmmakers well into the 1970s. We will analyze work by a range of French and other cinéastes, in an attempt to understand what perhaps appears--from the current perspective--as one of the last gasps of “high cultural” production against the reality of corporate necessity and new forms of media. Taught in English. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>999</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=David+Wills">David Wills</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">14:30 - 15:50 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>03</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

      <div id="breadcrumbs"><ul>	<li class="first"><a tabindex="181" href="/academics/french-studies/">French Studies</a></li>	<li><a tabindex="182" href="/academics/french-studies/courses" title="Display Department Course Information">Courses</a></li>	<li class="last"><span class="a">Advanced Oral and Written French: Traduction</span></li></ul></div>    </nav>
  </div>
  
  <!-- end #brown-masthead -->
  
        </header>
        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">
    <div class="banner-text">
      <a href="/academics/french-studies/" title="" style="height:252px;" class="bare-banner-link"></a>    </div>
  </section>
      
  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Advanced Oral and Written French: Traduction</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1510A S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 16084]</span></h3>


  	An introduction to the theory and practice of translation, this course will be designed to expand students' range and appreciation of written styles and registers and will be based on translation exercises and texts reflecting different types of written and oral communication.Texts will range from literary texts (excerpts from novels, plays, comic books...) to journalistic texts (articles from newspapers...). Class activities will also include comparative studies of translated texts, as well as grammar review and vocabulary work. Course taught in French. Written translations to and from French. Prerequisite: FREN 0600 or equivalent. Enrollment limited to 18. Instructor permission required. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>18</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Stephanie+A+Ravillon">Stephanie A Ravillon</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">12:00 - 12:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>12</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">L'Art de l'excès</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 2170M S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 16235]</span></h3>


  	This seminar considers the late 19th-century idea of decadence, understood as extravagant reaction to perceived social dissipation and political decline. We will focus on the esthetics, politics, and practices of excess in fin-de-siècle fiction. Topics include: decadent estheticism, proto-fascism, altered states, and non-normative sexualities. Authors include Eekhoud, Lorrain, Huysmans, Péladan, Rachilde, Lemonnier, Vivien. Fictional texts will be accompanied by contemporary non-fictional sources (Nordau, Bourget, Kraft-Ebbing, Lombroso). Taught in French.
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>16</dd>
		
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Gretchen+Schultz">Gretchen Schultz</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Wed - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>17</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>

<header id="header-region">
<section id="audience-gateways">
  <div class="marginator">
    <h6>Information For:</h6>
    <ul>
      <li id="gateway-current-students" class="first"><a href="/gateway/current-students">Current Students</a></li>
      <li id="gateway-faculty"><a href="/gateway/faculty">Faculty</a></li>
      <li id="gateway-staff"><a href="/gateway/staff">Staff</a></li>
      <li id="gateway-families"><a href="/gateway/families">Families</a></li>
      <li id="gateway-alumni"><a href="/gateway/alumni">Alumni</a></li>
      <li id="gateway-friends-and-neighbors" class="last"><a href="/gateway/friends-and-neighbors">Friends &amp; Neighbors</a></li>

</section>

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Modernismes poétiques</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1130G S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 16810]</span></h3>


  	Poetry begins with (more) white space on the page. The modernist remaking of poetry - beginning somewhere in the second half of the 19th century and lasting more or less through the first half of the 20th – brought about an exponential increase in the volume of that space, and in various other extensions of it (e.g. into design and drawing, into the unconscious). The course will follow those transformations by reading poems and other writings by selected poets from Rimbaud and Mallarmé to the surrealists and Ponge. Taught in French. Prerequisite: a course at the 0600- or 0700-level or equivalent proficiency. Contact the instructor to verify your proficiency if you have not taken French at Brown. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>40</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=David+Wills">David Wills</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
														<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Smith-Buonanno Hall">Smith-Buonanno Hall</a> G13</div>
						<div class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Wed - from Sep 6, 2017 to Sep 26, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
											<dd>
						<div class="room"><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/Facilities_Management/maps/index.php?query=Rockefeller Library">Rockefeller Library</a> 206</div>
						<div class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Wed - from Sep 27, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017						</div>
						</dd>
												
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>17</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>

        <section id="banner" class="marginator sub-banner" style="background-image:url(/academics/french-studies/sites/brown.edu.academics.french-studies/files/ursa_minor_simple_banner_image.jpg); height:252px;">

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Genre, sexualit?, et le roman du XIXe si?cle</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1060E S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 16811]</span></h3>


  	Examines novelistic constructions of gender and sexuality in relation to 19th-century French culture and literary movements, including romanticism, realism and naturalism, decadence, and the popular novel. Topics include constructions of homosexuality in literature and non-fiction, fatal femininity, besieged masculinity, sexuality and race, prostitution, bored housewives. Works by Balzac, Flaubert, Zola, Maupassant, Rachilde, accompanied by non-fictional sources in early sexology and criminology. Prerequisite: a course at the 0600- or 0700-level or equivalent proficiency. Contact the instructor to verify your proficiency if you have not taken French at Brown.  WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
		
		


		

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">13:00 - 14:20 Tue, Thu - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">L'expérience des réfugiés/immigrés</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 1410T S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 16812]</span></h3>


  	An exploration of the experience of refugees and immigrants with two components.  The first component consists of close study of the French context from Decolonization up through the current refugee crisis based on literature, film, the press, and critical essays.   The second component of this course will give students the opportunity to work with refugee/recent immigrant communities in Providence.  This is a community-engaged course requiring substantial commitment beyond the classroom.  Taught in French. Prerequisite: a course at the 0600- or 0700-level or equivalent proficiency. Contact the instructor to verify your proficiency if you have not taken French at Brown. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>20</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd>Writing - Designated Courses</dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Virginia+A+Krause">Virginia A Krause</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">15:00 - 17:30 Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>11</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>

  <div id="content">

                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Contes et identités francophones</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0720D S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 17306]</span></h3>


  	An introduction to the French-speaking world through folk- and fairy tales, we will examine how folktales have been used to define national and ethnic identities in France, Sénégal, the Caribbean, Louisiana, and Canada and consider how the study and rewriting of these traditions have redefined these identities. We will explore these questions by studying tale-types from all of the above regions, tales specific to each, and literary reworkings of folktales by writers, including d'Aulnoy, Perrault, Nothomb, Ben Jelloun, Diop, and Chamoiseau. Prerequisites: 5 on Advanced Placement testing, 700 and above SAT II, or instructor's permission.  Taught in French. FYS WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
					<dt>Credit Hours</dt>
			<dd>1</dd>
		
					<dt>Maximum Enrollment</dt>
			<dd>20</dd>
		
					<dt>Course Attributes</dt>
						<dd></dd>
			
		


												
	<dt>Primary Instructor</dt>

		<dd>
		<div class="vcard">
			<div>
						<a class="url fn" href="http://directory.brown.edu/search?search_string=Lewis+C+Seifert">Lewis C Seifert</a>
			</div>
			
			
		</div>
	</dd>
				
			

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">11:00 - 11:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
					<dt>Exam Group Code</dt>
			<dd>16</dd>
		


		</dl>
  </div>

  <!-- Layout -->
  
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">L?animal dans la culture contemporaine</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
  <div class="content brown-course-detail">
		
  	<h3>FREN 0750G S01 <span class="crn">[<abbr title="Course Reference Number">CRN</abbr>: 17418]</span></h3>


  	From reports of animals stranded in conflict zones and natural calamities, to cute or clever animals cast in advertisements and popular media, from the rat of Ratatouille to the caged orangutan of N?nette, the new interest in the animal marks an age of heightened awareness of the costs and ironies of the human story. We will consider in this course significant representations of the animal in contemporary French and Francophone literature, film, visual art, cultural theory and media representations. We will also revisit earlier moments linking the animal to modernity, including early film/photography and urban history. Taught in French. WRIT
		
		

		<dl>
		
		
		
		
		
		



					<dt>Term</dt>
			<dd>Fall 2017</dd>
		
		
		
		


		

	
					<dt>Meetings</dt>
									<dd>
						<span class="room"> </span>
						<span class="times">13:00 - 13:50 Mon, Wed, Fri - from Sep 6, 2017 to Dec 21, 2017</span>
						</dd>
							
		
		
		
		


		</dl>
  </div>

 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->
